avalancheActivity.comment: A small slab was reported in Bláfjöll on February 22nd along with small sluffs and cornice collapse.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is mostly considered stable. In isolated gullies and steep slopes high in mountains may be instabilities.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thaw on Monday affected the snowpack up to the mountain tops, and a significant amount of snow melted. The snowpack became uniform and has since stiffened and strengthened in cold weather. Small wind slabs may have formed in despressions and gullies since then, due to light snow showers and snow drift.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow binds poorly with older snow in the north and some avalanches have been falling. Snowfall on sunday and rain on Monday with warming could trigger avalanches in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow binds poorly with older snow and multiple avalanches have released in the North and East. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday could trigger avalanches in the east.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætisveður og þurrt um helgina, hlýnar þegar líður á sunnudag. Einhver úrkoma á mánudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Few wet slabs fell in thawing weather on Monday the 26th of February.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Small wind slabs could be present in SW-aspects in the mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack thawed on Monday as warming temperatures reached the mountains. NE snowfall has been falling a little bit this week and small wind slabs could have formed in SW aspects in the mountains. The old snowpack most likely got stronger after the thawing weather but 10-15 cm of new dry snow is now on top.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow binds poorly with older snow in the north and some avalanches have been falling. Snowfall on sunday and rain on Monday with warming could trigger avalanches in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow binds poorly with older snow and multiple avalanches have released in the North and East. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday could trigger avalanches in the east.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægar breytilegar áttir næstu daga og þurrt að mestu. Hlýnar á mánudag í austlægum áttum.

avalancheActivity.comment: A small avalanche was triggered by human activity in a southern aspect on Illviðrishnjúkur, 29.2.. Two avalanches released in Illviðrishnjúkur following snowfall on Tuesday, sized between 2 and 2.5. Several small slabs also fell in the area, along with small slabs in Ólafsfjörður. There was considerable avalanche activity in the region before last weekend and during the thaw on Monday. A slab avalanche was reported in Klaufabrekkuskarð, sized 2.5.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Dangerous avalanche conditions are in the region. Weakness is present in the new snow as it has widely drifted into S-facing aspects and formed wind slabs. Travelers should beware of steep slopes and exercise caution.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Unstable layers are widespread after the new snow from this week has drifted into southern aspects. A high temperature gradient is within the snowpack after thaw on Monday, followed by cold weather. The weaknesses may continue to develop in the upper and lower layers of the snowpack in the ongoing cold over the next few days. Stability tests have shown fractures with light to moderate loads in the new snow at apr. 30 cm depth. Propagation saw tests indicated that the older weakness still breaks fairly easily, and faceted crystals are still present. However, significant stress is required for an avalanche to occur on that layer since the upper layers have stiffened and bridged the lower layers after thawing.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow binds poorly with older snow in the north and some avalanches have been falling. Snowfall on sunday and rain on Monday with warming could trigger avalanches in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow binds poorly with older snow and multiple avalanches have released in the North and East. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday could trigger avalanches in the east.

weatherForecast.highlights: Logn og úrkomulaust að mestu um helgina. Frost allt að -15 til fjalla en hlýnar með Sunnudeginum. Austan snjókoma líkleg á mánudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A skier triggered a slab avalanche of size 2 in Stafdalur on Feb 25th. Two other avalanches occurred in Seyðisfjörður the same day. An avalanche occurred in Grænafell on Feb 21.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Updated 2.3. at 9:00: New snow that has added since Tuesday seems to bond poorly with older snow which has been though thaw. Considerable snowfall is forecasted on Sunday in E wind, followed by warm weather and rain. Then, avalanches should be expected.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow showers where in the area the night to Saturday 2.3. Around 20 cm new snow has been measures around Neskaupstaður but less other places. Last Monday, thaw reached up to high elevations and after that a little new snow has fallen and drifted, especially in N wind. Rather thin wind slabs have formed in most aspects, especially in slopes and gullies facing south, and stability tests indicate that a weak bond on the intersection with older snow. Considerable snowfall is forecasted on Sunday in E wind, especially close to the shores. Warm weather and rain follow right after. Then, avalanches should be expected, especially in the new snow.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow binds poorly with older snow in the north and some avalanches have been falling. Snowfall on sunday and rain on Monday with warming could trigger avalanches in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow binds poorly with older snow and multiple avalanches have released in the North and East. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday could trigger avalanches in the east.

weatherForecast.highlights: Minnkandi N-NV átt á laugardag og lítilsháttar él, mikið frost. Hlýnar smám saman á sunnudag með austlægum áttum og snjókomu til fjalla. Aðfaranótt mánudags á hiti að fara yfir frostmark og byrja að rigna hátt upp í hlíðar.
